verses.verse: Wine <S%H3196><s%> is a mocker, <S%H3887><s%> strong drink <S%H7941><s%> is raging: <S%H1993><s%> and whoever <S%H3605><s%> is deceived <S%H7686><s%> thereby is not wise. <S%H2449><s%>

The fear <S%H367><s%> of a king <S%H4428><s%> is as the roaring <S%H5099><s%> of a lion: <S%H3715><s%> whoever provokes <S%H5674><s%> him to anger <S%H5674><s%> sins <S%H2398><s%> against his own soul. <S%H5315><s%>
It is an honor <S%H3519><s%> for a man <S%H376><s%> to cease <S%H7674><s%> from strife: <S%H7379><s%> but every <S%H3605><s%> fool <S%H191><s%> will be meddling. <S%H1566><s%>
The sluggard <S%H6102><s%> will not plow <S%H2790><s%> by reason of the cold; <S%H2779><s%> therefore shall he beg <S%H7592><s%> in harvest, <S%H7105><s%> and have nothing. <S%H369><s%>

Counsel <S%H6098><s%> in the heart <S%H3820><s%> of man <S%H376><s%> is like deep <S%H6013><s%> water; <S%H4325><s%> but a man <S%H376><s%> of understanding <S%H8394><s%> will draw <S%H1802><s%> it out.

Most <S%H7230><s%> men <S%H120><s%> will proclaim <S%H7121><s%> every <S%H376><s%> one <S%H376><s%> his own goodness: <S%H2617><s%> but a faithful <S%H529><s%> man <S%H376><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> can find? <S%H4672><s%>
The just <S%H6662><s%> man walks <S%H1980><s%> in his integrity: <S%H8537><s%> his children <S%H1121><s%> are blessed <S%H835><s%> after <S%H310><s%> him.
A king <S%H4428><s%> that sits <S%H3427><s%> in the throne <S%H3678><s%> of judgment <S%H1779><s%> scatters <S%H2219><s%> away all <S%H3605><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> with his eyes. <S%H5869><s%>
Who <S%H4310><s%> can say, <S%H559><s%> I have made my heart <S%H3820><s%> clean, <S%H2135><s%> I am pure <S%H2891><s%> from my sin? <S%H2403><s%>
Divers weights, <S%H68><s%> and divers measures, <S%H374><s%> both <S%H8147><s%> of them are alike <S%H1571><s%> abomination <S%H8441><s%> to the LORD. <S%H3068><s%>

Even <S%H1571><s%> a child <S%H5288><s%> is known <S%H5234><s%> by his doings, <S%H4611><s%> whether <S%H518><s%> his work <S%H6467><s%> be pure, <S%H2134><s%> and whether <S%H518><s%> it be right. <S%H3477><s%>
The hearing <S%H8085><s%> ear, <S%H241><s%> and the seeing <S%H7200><s%> eye, <S%H5869><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> has made <S%H6213><s%> even <S%H1571><s%> both <S%H8147><s%> of them.

Love <S%H157><s%> not sleep, <S%H8142><s%> lest <S%H6435><s%> you come to poverty; <S%H3423><s%> open <S%H6491><s%> your eyes, <S%H5869><s%> and you shall be satisfied <S%H7646><s%> with bread. <S%H3899><s%>
It is naught, <S%H7451><s%> it is naught, <S%H7451><s%> said <S%H559><s%> the buyer: <S%H7069><s%> but when he is gone <S%H235><s%> his way, then <S%H227><s%> he boasts. <S%H1984><s%>
There is gold, <S%H2091><s%> and a multitude <S%H7230><s%> of rubies: <S%H6443><s%> but the lips <S%H8193><s%> of knowledge <S%H1847><s%> are a precious <S%H3366><s%> jewel. <S%H3627><s%>
Take <S%H3947><s%> his garment <S%H899><s%> that is surety <S%H6148><s%> for a stranger: <S%H2114><s%> and take <S%H2254><s%> a pledge <S%H2254><s%> of him for a strange <S%H5237><s%> woman.
Bread <S%H3899><s%> of deceit <S%H8267><s%> is sweet <S%H6149><s%> to a man; <S%H376><s%> but afterwards <S%H310><s%> his mouth <S%H6310><s%> shall be filled <S%H4390><s%> with gravel. <S%H2687><s%>
Every purpose <S%H4284><s%> is established <S%H3559><s%> by counsel: <S%H6098><s%> and with good advice <S%H8458><s%> make <S%H6213><s%> war. <S%H4421><s%>

He that goes <S%H1980><s%> about <S%H1980><s%> as a talebearer <S%H7400><s%> reveals <S%H1540><s%> secrets: <S%H5475><s%> therefore meddle <S%H6148><s%> not with him that flatters <S%H6601><s%> with his lips. <S%H8193><s%>
Whoever curses <S%H7043><s%> his father <S%H1><s%> or his mother, <S%H517><s%> his lamp <S%H5216><s%> shall be put <S%H1846><s%> out in obscure <S%H380><s%> darkness. <S%H2822><s%>
An inheritance <S%H5159><s%> may be gotten hastily <S%H926><s%> at the beginning; <S%H7223><s%> but the end <S%H319><s%> thereof shall not be blessed. <S%H1288><s%>
Say <S%H559><s%> not you, I will recompense <S%H7999><s%> evil; <S%H7451><s%> but wait <S%H6960><s%> on the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> and he shall save <S%H3467><s%> you.
Divers weights <S%H68><s%> are an abomination <S%H8441><s%> to the LORD; <S%H3068><s%> and a false <S%H4820><s%> balance <S%H3976><s%> is not good. <S%H2896><s%>
Man's <S%H1397><s%> goings <S%H4703><s%> are of the LORD; <S%H3068><s%> how <S%H4100><s%> can a man <S%H120><s%> then understand <S%H995><s%> his own way? <S%H1870><s%>
It is a snare <S%H4170><s%> to the man <S%H120><s%> who devours <S%H3216><s%> that which is holy, <S%H6944><s%> and after <S%H310><s%> vows <S%H5088><s%> to make inquiry. <S%H1239><s%>
A wise <S%H2450><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> scatters <S%H2219><s%> the wicked, <S%H7563><s%> and brings <S%H7725><s%> the wheel <S%H212><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> them.
The spirit <S%H5397><s%> of man <S%H120><s%> is the candle <S%H5216><s%> of the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> searching <S%H2664><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the inward <S%H2315><s%> parts of the belly. <S%H990><s%>
Mercy <S%H2617><s%> and truth <S%H571><s%> preserve <S%H5341><s%> the king: <S%H4428><s%> and his throne <S%H3678><s%> is upheld <S%H5582><s%> by mercy. <S%H2617><s%>
The glory <S%H8597><s%> of young <S%H970><s%> men is their strength: <S%H3581><s%> and the beauty <S%H1926><s%> of old <S%H2205><s%> men is the grey <S%H7872><s%> head.
The blueness <S%H2250><s%> of a wound <S%H6482><s%> cleans <S%H8562><s%> away evil: <S%H7451><s%> so do stripes <S%H4347><s%> the inward <S%H2315><s%> parts of the belly. <S%H990><s%>
